trial_identification.studytitle: Investigation of Caspofungin Eye Drops for the Treatment of Fungal Eye Infections
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Ocular Penetration of Caspofungin Eye Drops in the Treatment of Fungal Keratitis

interventions.interventions: One drop of 0.5% Caspofungin eye drops will be administered hourly into the eye that will be operated on (commencing 4 hours before participant's elective surgery).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Penetration of Caspofungin into the aqueous humour of the eye. The concentration of caspofungin in the eyes will be measured using high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) or liquid-chromatography-mass-spectrometry (LC-MS).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: An hour after the last dose given. One drop hourly (commencing 4 hours before participant's elective surgery).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Adequate concentration of caspofungin achieved in the aqueous humour of the eye to treat fungal keratitis. The concentration of caspofungin in the eyes will be measured using high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) or liquid-chromatography-mass-spectrometry (LC-MS).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: An hour after the last dose given. One drop hourly (commencing 4 hours before participant's elective surgery).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients attending for elective eye surgery (eg. cataract surgery)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Participants in whom the use of caspofungin is contraindicated (eg. pregnancy, hypersensitivity to caspofungin or its formulation, risk of clinically significant drug interactions or as per caspofungin's product information guide)

fundingsource.fundingname: Contributing to Australian Scholarship & Sciences (CASS) Foundation

othercollaborator.othercollaboratorname: The Royal Victorian Eye & Ear Hospital (RVEEH)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This proposed study is intended to investigate if the antifungal drug, caspofungin, when applied as an eye drop is able to penetrate into the human eyes. The use of caspofungin as an eye drops in human has never been reported. Caspofungin eye drops are anticipated to safely penetrate into the human eyes when applied as eye drops and to achieve adequate concentrations to treat fungal eye infections.
